(1 comment)
What UIs?  Do we have a link to a Redfish schema you are trying to fulfill?

The BMC GUI will display the cable status information to the user.
yes, The Redfish schema I am following is  https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/master/static/redfish/v1/JsonSchemas/Cable/Cable.json#L303
Please reference the schema in the commit message.  You don't need the link to it, but at least reference that these enumerations are coming from the Cable schema from Redfish.
Done

I don't know what these mean.  How is a cable "running"?

What is the difference between inactive and off?  Sounds the same to me.
I have modified the enum values based on the redfish schema.

I generally do not like blindly copying every enumeration that exists in Redfish.  Do you have a pruned down list that your implementation is actually planning to use?  Can we get down to just that list.

It's hard to reason about all these enumerations and likely leads to someone picking the wrong one (or a new one that isn't fully supported across the whole platform).  Additionally, the Redfish schemas can drift from version to version and add new enumerations, which our dbus specs won't follow.  It's better to only express what we want to use.
Ack, I have defined only the enumerations my implementation is planning to use.

Hi Patrick,
Took a few days to upload the next patch set as I was understanding the internal implementations corresponding to the cable status value changes. Sorry for the delay.

Generally, I don't want to add "Status" to inventory objects.  Inventory should be mostly static so that daemons wanting to only know about new inventory items can easily filter those events from events that happen more often.

Can you create a new interface under State (or Control?) to represent the cable state?

If you look at the interfaces under State/Decorator, most of these are reusable across multiple entities.  Looking at the enumerations you have below, these seem very similar to some of the other Redfish status enumerations (like maybe Health related?).  Could we make something that is not cable-specific?

Redfish still has Cable "Status""State" and "Status""Health".  :/ 
We map Health = Critical when Functional = false. 
Map State = Absent when Present = false. 

Redfish's cable status long description mentions how to tie this in with Cable's Status State and Status Health. (I don't think that should be included in the PDI.) (I don't think bmcweb should enforce that either.) I think we should keep the existing mapping for State/Status, and whatever backend implements this can set this Cable Status, Functional, and Present. 

I vote for a new State or Control interface for the cable state. Using only the 3/4 this implementation actually needs.

            "enumLongDescriptions": {
                "Degraded": "This value shall indicate the cable is degraded.  The State property in Status shall contain the value `Enabled` and the Health property in Status shall contain the value `Warning`.",
                "Disabled": "This value shall indicate the cable is disabled.  The State property in Status shall contain the value `Disabled`.",
                "Failed": "This value shall indicate the cable has failed.  The State property in Status shall contain the value `Enabled` and the Health property in Status shall contain the value `Critical`.",
                "Normal": "This value shall indicate the cable is operating normally.  The State property in Status shall contain the value `Enabled` and the Health property in Status shall contain the value `OK`.",
                "SetByService": "This value shall indicate the status for the cable is not defined by the user.  If implemented, the service shall determine the value of the State and Health properties in Status.",
                "Testing": "This value shall indicate the cable is under test.  The State property in Status shall contain the value `InTest`."
            },
Ack, I have created a new CableState interface for the same. Could you please suggest if the interface name is okay or need a more generic name?
I have made the interface more generic as "FruStatus.interface".
Is this new addition to BMC GUI?

Yeah, could be added to webui-vue. 
Today, there isn't any cable support in webui-vue, but there is no reason that it can't be added.
yeah
can be modified to Redfish User
Done
When do we have cable state as disabled? It is good to add more details in the description.
Acknowledged

Why is it required to be a FRU?

How is this different from OpertationalStatus?  Which are intended to be used and when?

We should probably write some documents that explain this?

@Patrick, The Operational Status is a boolean property defining if it's functional or not. I feel the interface "FruStatus" is more granular, giving us an enumeration of different status values FRU can have.

> Why is it required to be a FRU?

I tried to change the interface name to "Status.interface"(Patchset 8) but I hit an error "Property name has the same name as the class in which it is declared". Is it expected?

I feel with this interface we are trying to provide more granularity to the issue. Can you please suggest how we could name this interface?

How will we map this for other Redfish resources? 
Will this ever be used other than cable? 
I personally think something unique to cable (your patchset 7) is better https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/70087/7/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/State/Decorator/CableState.interface.yaml

> Will this ever be used other than cable?
@Gunnar, yes we could use these Status values for any other FRUs in future.

> I personally think something unique to cable (your patchset 7) is better https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/70087/7/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/State/Decorator/CableState.interface.yaml

Acknowledged. We could have a more generic name.
Moved it back to CableState

Unknown will map to null?

From https://www.dmtf.org/sites/default/files/standards/documents/DSP0266_1.20.0.html
9.5 Common data types
...
null value, which the service uses when it is unable to determine the property's value due to an error or other temporary condition
Yes, correct
Done

Seems reasonable to me. Maps to Redfish's CableStatus. 
http://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/Cable.v1_2_2.json#/definitions/CableStatus

I'm partially confused by the utility of this interface vs what I see in Redfish.  Based on the words here, do we actually need a new interface?

```
            "enumLongDescriptions": {
                "Degraded": "This value shall indicate the cable is degraded.  The State property in Status shall contain the value `Enabled` and the Health property in Status shall contain the value `Warning`.",
                "Disabled": "This value shall indicate the cable is disabled.  The State property in Status shall contain the value `Disabled`.",
                "Failed": "This value shall indicate the cable has failed.  The State property in Status shall contain the value `Enabled` and the Health property in Status shall contain the value `Critical`.",
                "Normal": "This value shall indicate the cable is operating normally.  The State property in Status shall contain the value `Enabled` and the Health property in Status shall contain the value `OK`.",
                "SetByService": "This value shall indicate the status for the cable is not defined by the user.  If implemented, the service shall determine the value of the State and Health properties in Status.",
                "Testing": "This value shall indicate the cable is under test.  The State property in Status shall contain the value `InTest`."
            },
```

The words in `SetByService` imply to me that the values in this property are intended to be set by external users and not represent the "health" status of the cable.  The health of the cable seems to be drawn from State/Health properties just like every other object.

Under what conditions would we want to expose this property using this dbus property?  What service is doing it?  How does it know the cable state?  Why is that different than State/Health?  What happens if the user tries to set one of these (externally via Redfish)?

Do we need a full design on this?

Taking a step back...

We want to be able to show the "status" of our cable, starting with the cables to this I/O expansion drawer.

Specifically for this I/O expansion drawer cable (in "()" is what we thought the Redfish mapping was using this "CableStatus"):

Running (Normal) -> PCI-E traffic is currently active across the cable.
Inactive (Failed) -> The Cable card it is attached to is powered on, but no traffic is running (the link train failed, the drawer it is connected to failed, or the read from the hardware failed). 
PoweredOff (Disabled) -> The cable card the cable is attached to is powered off. 
Unknown (null) -> We do not know the status. 


> I'm partially confused by the utility of this interface vs what I see in Redfish. 

> The words in SetByService imply to me that the values in this property are intended to be set by external users and not represent the "health" status of the cable. 


This is readwrite, so I guess Redfish intends for clients to set it.
  
                "CableStatus": {
                    "$ref": "#/definitions/CableStatus",
                    "description": "The user-reported status of this resource.",
                    "longDescription": "This property shall contain the user-reported status of this resource.",
                    "readonly": false
                },

I read that SetByService a few times, maybe if we used this property, that would be the value we would use since we don't allow users to set "CableStatus" and it is indeed coming from the service.

Can we just use State/Health..?
Looking at https://www.dmtf.org/sites/default/files/standards/documents/DSP0268_2024.1.html does a mapping like this work?


    Running => Enabled/Ok
    PoweredOff => Disabled/Ok
    Inactive => StandbyOffline/Critical
    Unknown => Quiesced/Critical

> Do we need a full design on this?
 
Maybe we just need some way to mark the cable as "Disabled"/"StandbyOffline"/"Quiesced" and then we don't need this new CableStatus interface at all?

Ok/Critical is mapped to OperationalStatus today, but bmcweb doesn't have support for Redfish States Disabled, StandbyOffline, Quisced for inventory. 

There is support today for some of those for Power States. 
https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/20fa6a2c6cea77a4b411634dfca67eef6c8f430f/redfish-core/lib/systems.hpp#L567
https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/20fa6a2c6cea77a4b411634dfca67eef6c8f430f/redfish-core/lib/chassis.hpp#L131
state of the cable is only for active cables, I think we need more information above Active cable vs passive cable.
Done
The Functional Property should be false in this case.. But idk if you want to tie them together.
Acknowledged
better to document what is the different between failed and disable here ?
Done

@Ed,
Taking Patrick’s suggestion into consideration we tried doing a full design on this. If this mapping would work from the bmcweb side then we do not need this interface at all.

As Gunnar mentioned in the above comment,
We had to expose the Cable Status-  Running, PoweredOff, Inactive, Unknown on the Dbus. So we tried mapping these values to the redfish enums, but Patrick suggested we use the existing Status.State and Status.Health interface values and map them to the values we had. So we came up with a design to map as below.

In bmcweb we map
Status.State ===> uses OperationalStatus (Functional)
Status.Health ===> uses Present Property
In addition, we also thought of using the Enabled property and PowerState property to determine the values.

States that needs a mapping in Redfish
`Running => Ok/Enabled
Inactive => Critical/StandbyOffline
PoweredOff => Ok/Disabled
Unknown => Critical/UnavailableOffline`

Detailed mapping is as below:
1. Running
`Status
{
	Health = Ok         if ===> Functional = true (Operational Status)
	State = Enabled     if ===>  Present property  = true , Enabled property = true
	PowerState = On     if ====>  Powerstate property = On
}`
2. Inactive
`Status
{
	Health = Critical       if ===>Functional = false (Operational Status)
	State = StandbyOffline  if ===> Present property = true , Enabled property = false
	PowerState = On         if ===> Powerstate property = On
}`
3. PoweredOff:
`Status
{
	Health = Ok       if ===> Functional = true (Operational Status)
	State = Disabled  if===> Present property = false , Enabled property= false
	PowerState = Off  if ===> Powerstate property = Off
}`
4. Unknown:
`Status
{
	Health = Critical             if ===> Functional = false (Operational Status)
	State =  UnavailableOffline   if ===> Present property = false , Enabled property = false
	PowerState = null             if ===> No Powerstate Interface
}`

Need your suggestion if this would be okay to be mapped in bmcweb. Or any other inputs too.

Thanks!
Just marked this comment unresolved.

None of this information seems specific to cables.  Why is it "CableState" and not a more generic status interface?

We have Availability and OperationalStatus right now, but these are just booleans.  It would not surprise me if we should really be expanding these to have an enumeration rather than a boolean.
nit: we don't need strings around these.
nit: we don't need strings around these.
